title: @Meddler Context on PBE Talon nerfs?
body:
>Talon
>
>Shadow Assault (R) 
> Cooldown increased to 100/80/60 from 75/65/55
>Mana cost increased to 100 at all ranks from 80/90/100.

Mana cost I'm assuming is just to normalize it since he's an older champion. But it's worth noting that it had 80 instead of 100 because his W requires such a high amount of mana and needs to be used fairly often in order to win the lane as Talon. It is my belief that his ultimate's mana cost wasn't standard because of this, in order to keep him a viable champion.

Also, that's a rather drastic cooldown increase. Since the nerfs he received a couple years ago to his base values and scaling values, his ultimate hasn't been a hard hitting spell in the first half of the game. What's the context behind reducing its availability? 

Thanks for reading.

replies.body:
There are a couple of things behind that Talon nerf:

1. We believe assassins are healthiest when a proportion of their burst's gated behind a long CD, particularly if they've got a really reliable kill pattern. By nature of their high target selection and burst assassins tend to have lower tactical counterplay than most other classes, so giving their opponents a window to play with where they're noticeably weaker's important. Talon's certainly not the only assassin with that issue either.

2. We do think Talon is too strong however. He's been on the strong side in solo queue for a really long period of time. We've held off on nerfing him in the past though since his play rate hasn't been that high so he hasn't been an urgent issue. At this point though he's been too strong for long enough we feel it's the appropriate time to act, hence the above nerf aimed at making him a bit healthier as well as cutting a bit of power.


Long term we do want to do some more substantial work on Talon. In particular if we do an assassin class update at some point he'd be one of the most likely candidates for moderate sized changes, given he's got a theme with a lot of potential but a kit that does really standard stuff.

The data is heavily skewed. He has double the pick-rate and 1% less win-rate. Talon is used mainly as a counter-pick and typically by players who play him frequently.

If Talon's going to get nerfed on his ult, can't you give him a useful passive? It hardly does anything, it adheres to the whole "empty stats" with barely any interaction from the player. Sure it's some damage whenever you use W or E, but unless you're paired with a really cc heavy team, it's not going to do much. 

I can understand nerfing the CD of the ult, but the mana cost? He's already got mana troubles in lane due to his inability to kill targets pre-6. He's one of the few assassins that is really gated by mana this early. He relies heavily on his W to harass/farm, but with the removal of mana pots, he's pretty helpless in lane unless he gets corrupted potion, which still only takes the edge off because 50 mana isn't even enough for one W. Other assassins can either kill early or aren't gated by mana as heavily. The only reason his play rate is so high right now is because of {{item:3147}} . If you happen to look at the pick rates, both Talon and Zed jumped in popularity when it released. Nerfing Talon's mana costs when he isn't really that great in a spot only makes it so no one picks him again. Zed's got a more stabilized win rate thanks to the fact that he's got such a high pick rate, it balances out. Talon's is a rollercoaster due to his low pick rate, it changes slightly with each patch, and with the various different players that actually decide to play him. Zed can do everything Talon can do but better for the most part: waveclear, safety, last hitting. The only thing Talon can do that Zed can't is more AoE damage because he's got two spells that can do that, while zed mainly has one, while the other weakens dramatically after the first hit. Talon can't buy more mana regen because all mana regen items are AP except for {{item:3508}} which could be viable for him, but he's better off getting more armor penetration or flat damage in order to maximize his damage. Crits would rarely help him win a lane thanks to their RNG nature.

TL;DR Nerfing Talon's mana cost is just going to put him back into obscurity.
